comment.author: 31324280@N02
comment._content: Agreed, looks like North American AT-6 Texan (or Harvard when in UK use).

comment.author: 10659106@N00
comment._content: @fulvue, yes, but those fin stripes make them AAF for sure. From this angle the viewer cannot ascertain if the gear is retractable - or not.  But...because there are so many...AT-6 is a very safe guess!

comment.author: 61304380@N00
comment._content: Is the curved rudder more indicative of a BT-9 than the later AT-6 which had a straight edged rudder?

comment.author: 10659106@N00
comment._content: Good observation! I think you're right about the BT-9! This isn't a great pic - I would like to see the fabric on the fuselage...

comment.author: 52583849@N04
comment._content: North American BC-1 lineup - note the fabric sides and the square rudder, which predates the entire AT-6 series. These were roughly equivalent to the Harvard I but with the flip up rear canopy.
